page.title: 09EMPLOYMENT - BARGOED AREA
page.content: HISTORY From the early 19th Century there was a steady growth in the town of Bargoed and its neighbouring villages, and up to the time of the First World War, the Rhymney Valley flourished with the great demand for coal. There followed a period of depression, and from 1945 to the present the decline continued, culminating in the closure of the Bargoed Colliery in 1978 and of the Bargoed Coal Washery in 1981. Production at the Britannia Colliery ceased in 1983 - and ALL the larger factories providing employment in the area were badly hit by the recession. PRESENT - Attempts were made to introduce suitable alternative industry to the area and there are some successful but small local firms, offering mainly female employment.{
